intro: Vaccinium macraeanum, commonly known as the Macraean heath, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive waxy coating. Vaccinium macraeanum thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
